physical_appearance:This is a drawn fabric template. It consists of a horizontal scrolling floral pattern on a long canvas. Along the central pattern is a repeating motif of a pair of birds flanking a singular lily stalk. The motif is set against a foliate background
 with a row of flowers on either side of the pattern.

sgcool_label_text:Fabric templates were used to guide the embroiderer. Along the central border is a repeating motif of a pair of birds flanking a singular lily stalk
 set against a foliate background. A row of flowers on both sides complete the pattern.\r\n\r\nThe small holes of double-thread Penelope canvas and other kinds of counted-thread canvases
 made it possible to create out of beads designs which were originally used for silk embroidery. The fabric was cut diagonally so as to align beads in a vertical position.\r\n

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
Fabric templates were used to guide the embroiderer. Along the central border is a repeating motif of a pair of birds flanking a singular lily stalk, set against a foliate background. A row of flowers on both sides complete the pattern.

The small holes of double-thread Penelope canvas and other kinds of counted-thread canvases, made it possible to create out of beads designs which were originally used for silk embroidery. The fabric was cut diagonally so as to align beads in a vertical position.
